Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student in the school.

admissionNumber.description: Unique identifier for the student. (Primary Key)

firstName.description: The first name of the student.

lastName.description: The last name of the student.

class.description: The class or grade the student is in.

stream.description: The stream or section the student is in. (Optional)

year.description: The year the student is in.

uploadedAt.description: Timestamp of when the student data was uploaded.

uploadedBy.description: User ID of who uploaded the student data.

ChoirMember.title: ChoirMember
ChoirMember.description: Represents a student's membership in the choir.

admissionNumber.description: Reference to Student. Unique identifier for the choir member. (Primary Key, Relationship: Student 1:1 ChoirMember)

class.description: The class or grade of the choir member.

status.description: The status of the choir member (active/inactive).

dateJoined.description: The date the student joined the choir.

addedBy.description: User ID of who added the student to the choir.

ChoirAttendance.title: ChoirAttendance
ChoirAttendance.description: Represents attendance records for a choir practice session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the attendance record. (Primary Key). Format: YYYY-MM-DD_practiceType (e.g., 2026-02-01_evening)

date.description: The date of the choir practice.

practiceType.description: The type of choir practice (e.g., morning, evening).

classFilter.description: Optional filter for the class (e.g., Form 3).

attendanceMap.description: Map of student admission numbers to attendance status (true=present, false=absent).

recordedBy.description: User ID of who recorded the attendance.

recordedAt.description: Timestamp of when the attendance was recorded.

definition.description: Stores student data. Document ID is the admissionNumber.

params.name: admissionNumber
params.description: The unique admission number of the student (primary key).

definition.description: Stores choir membership data. Document ID is the admissionNumber, referencing the student.

params.name: admissionNumber
params.description: The unique admission number of the choir member (primary key).

definition.description: Stores choir attendance records. Document ID is a combination of date and practice type (YYYY-MM-DD_practiceType).

params.name: attendanceId
params.description: The unique ID for the attendance record (YYYY-MM-DD_practiceType).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support the school choir attendance management system with a focus on generating printable reports. Key considerations include: 

*   **Authorization Independence:** Each collection is designed to be accessed independently, avoiding `get()` calls in security rules.  Specifically, denormalization isn't needed for `students` and `choir_members` because access is managed on upload and membership. For attendance, access control will depend on the rules you implement on the UI; there is no owner or shared access scenario.
*   **QAPs (Queryability and Performance):**  The segregation of data into distinct collections (`students`, `choir_members`, `choir_attendance`) simplifies queries and improves performance. The structure facilitates efficient `list` operations for attendance reports based on date ranges, classes, or terms.
*   **Scalability:** The structure allows for efficient querying and report generation even with a large number of students and attendance records.
*   **Report Generation:** The structure optimizes querying for report generation, allowing for easy retrieval of necessary data.

To enhance the design further, consider the following:

*   **Indexes:** Define composite indexes for common queries, especially those used for report generation (e.g., queries based on date ranges and classes in `choir_attendance`).
*   **Data Validation:** Implement client-side and server-side data validation to ensure data integrity, especially for mandatory fields.
*   **Error Handling:** Implement robust error handling for file uploads and data processing to prevent data loss and ensure system stability.
*   **Security Rules:**  Implement comprehensive security rules to protect data and ensure that only authorized users can access and modify data.
